channel.title: Business and financial news - CNNMoney.com
channel.description: CNNMoney.com, the business website of CNN, combines business news and in-depth market analysis with practical advice and answers to personal finance questions.

image.title: Business and financial news - CNNMoney.com
image.description: CNNMoney.com, the business website of CNN, combines business news and in-depth market analysis with practical advice and answers to personal finance questions.

item.title: 7 things to know before the bell
item.description: Read full story for latest details.

item.title: SoftBank and Toyota want driverless cars to change the world
item.description: Softbank and Toyota are partnering on an effort to use autonomous vehicles and other technologies to change the world of transportation.

item.title: Aston Martin falls 5% in its London IPO
item.description: Aston Martin is joining the ranks of listed automakers with an IPO that values the British company at more than $5 billion.

item.title: Barnes & Noble stock soars 20% as it explores a sale
item.description: Barnes & Noble jumped more than 20% after it said it would review a sale of the troubled company.

item.title: Why it's time for investors to go on the defense
item.description: Howard Marks, co-chairman of Oaktree Capital, explains why investors should start treading lightly.

item.title: The Toys 'R' Us brand may be brought back to life
item.description: Bankrupt toy retailer tells bankruptcy court it is looking at possibly reviving the Toys 'R' Us and Babies 'R' Us brands.

item.title: The internet industry is suing California over its net neutrality law
item.description: Broadband trade groups and the DOJ have filed lawsuits over California's days-old law protecting net neutrality.

item.title: Priyanka Chopra is helping Bumble expand in India
item.description: It's the latest online dating app to compete for the hearts of women in India.

item.title: Microsoft unveils new Surface devices
item.description: Microsoft announced a new version of its desktop computer Surface Studio, and its first pair of smart headphones. It also announced the Surface Pro 6 and Surface Laptop 2.

item.title: Getting health insurance through work now costs nearly $20,000
item.description: Family health insurance now costs employers and workers nearly $20,000 a year, on average, according to a new report.

item.title: All eyes on Congress as vote on Kavanaugh draws near
item.description: The lead story for Thursday's morning shows: The impending vote to advance Brett Kavanaugh's nomination to the Supreme Court.

item.title: She was the first openly gay CEO at a Fortune 500 company
item.description: Land O'Lakes CEO Beth Ford charts her career path, from her first job to becoming the first openly gay CEO at a Fortune 500 company in an interview with CNN's Boss Files.

item.title: Crypto companies are trying to cash in at a really bad time
item.description: The world's top makers of bitcoin mining technology hope to raise money from investors by selling shares in Hong Kong.

item.title: It's getting a lot harder for global brands to win in China
item.description: Changing tastes and the challenge from new Chinese rivals are forcing US and European companies including Apple and Starbucks to adopt new strategies to succeed in the world's second biggest economy.

item.title: Facebook doesn't think hackers accessed third-party sites
item.description: Read full story for latest details.

item.title: A llama, bagel and frisbee: Apple's new iOS 12.1 emoji
item.description: A collection of new emoji is coming to iOS 12.1 for iPhone and iPad users, including food and cute animals.

item.title: Tencent Music aims to raise $1 billion by going public
item.description: Tencent Music dominates the music streaming market in China through its Spotify-like apps.

item.title: Tesla needed some good news. These sales numbers help
item.description: Read full story for latest details.

item.title: Volkswagen dumps jailed Audi CEO
item.description: Volkswagen has severed ties with suspended Audi CEO Rupert Stadler, who has been jailed since June in connection with an emissions investigation.

item.title: S&P downgrades debt-riddled GE and GE Capital
item.description: New General Electric boss Larry Culp just got a fresh reminder of the debt-riddled balance sheet he's inheriting.
